thread.title: U.S. men’s soccer team earns berth in CONCACAF Olympic qualifying semifinals
thread.title_full: U.S. men’s soccer team earns berth in CONCACAF Olympic qualifying semifinals

author: Seattle Times staff
title: U.S. men’s soccer team earns berth in CONCACAF Olympic qualifying semifinals
text:
U.S. men’s soccer team earns berth in CONCACAF Olympic qualifying semifinals Originally published October 3, 2015 at 6:40 pm U.S. defender Matt Miazga (3) celebrates with midfielder Marc Pelosi after a goal in Saturday’s 6-1 soccer victory over Cuba in Kansas City, Kan. (Charlie Riedel/AP) Jerome Kieswetter scored twice as the U.S. Under-23 men’s soccer team routed Cuba 6-1 in Kansas City, Kan., to clinch a berth in the CONCACAF Olympic qualifying tournament semifinals. U.S. national-team soccer Men are in semifinals 
Jerome Kieswetter scored twice as the U.S. Under-23 men’s team routed Cuba 6-1 on Saturday in Kansas City, Kan., to clinch a berth in the CONCACAF Olympic qualifying tournament semifinals. 
The United States plays its final group-stage match Tuesday against Panama in Commerce City, Colo. 
The top two teams from each group move on to the semifinals and the two finalists advance to next year’s Olympics in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. The winner of the third-place CONCACAF match faces Colombia in a one-game playoff for an Olympic berth. 
Cuba took on the United States with four bench players, two of them goalkeepers, after a wave of players perhaps defected. CONCACAF officials confirmed Wednesday that three Cuba players were missing; a fourth did not show up for Thursday’s 1-1 draw with Panama and a fifth was absent Saturday. 2 Sounders make roster Unlimited Digital Access. $1 for 4 weeks. 
Forward Clint Dempsey and defender Brad Evans of the Sounders are among the 23 players on the U.S. roster for Saturday’s match against Mexico at the Rose Bowl in Pasadena, Calif. The winner earns a spot in the 2017 FIFA Confederations Cup in Russia. 
Midfielder DeAndre Yedlin, a former Sounder who plays for Sunderland of England, also is on the U.S. roster. 
Coach Jurgen Klinsmann said, “This is about having a group of players who understand exactly now what this is all about. This is about momentum. This is about high energy. This is about representing my country.” 
Klinsmann dropped defenders John Brooks and Omar Gonzalez and midfielder Mix Diskerud from the roster. European soccer Chelsea loses again 
Chelsea, the defending English Premier League champion, lost 3-1 at home to Southampton — its fourth loss of the season. 
Manager Jose Mourinho said he won’t leave his job without a fight. 
“If the club wants to sack me, they have to sack me, because I’m not running away from my responsibility, my team,” Mourinho told Sky Sports television. 
Sergio Aguero scored five goals to lead Manchester City to a 6-1 victory over Newcastle. He scored four times in a span of 13 minutes in the second half. ELSEWHERE 
• Tonalist won the $1 million Jockey Club Gold Cup at Belmont Park in Elmont, N.Y., for the second consecutive year. 
Tonalist, a 4-year-old colt trained by Christophe Clement and ridden by John Velazquez , beat Wicked Strong by 4¾ lengths. Tonalist ran 1¼ miles on a sealed, sloppy track in 2 minutes, 2.16 seconds. The 2014 Belmont Stakes winner paid $4 to win in the Grade I race. 
• American Venus Williams won the Wuhan Open tennis tournament in China when her opponent, fifth-seeded Garbine Muguruza of Spain, stopped playing because of a left-ankle injury while trailing 6-3, 3-0. 
It was the unseeded Williams’ 47th WTA Tour singles title. 
“It’s not easy when you don’t play your best,” Williams told Muguruza, adding, “I probably didn’t have a chance if you felt well.” 
Muguruza said she was “very sorry” to have to stop playing. 
• The NBA Sacramento Kings picked up the 2016-17 option on guard B en McLemore ’s contract. Seattle Times news services
